result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

state's reply due one week prior to hearing. KED 9/28/22
Defendants Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Illegally Seized Evidence

Defendant Luis O. Cruz in court.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Luis O. Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maynard will be filing a motion to suppress evidence. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis O. Cruz in court.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Luis O. Cruz. No resolution. Case to be re-assigned. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luis O. Cruz in court.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Luis O. Cruz. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:18 PM Defendant Luis O. Cruz in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Luis O. Cruz.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Kim plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Defendant Luis O. Cruz appeared in court, Attorney Tony Kim for Luis O. Cruz appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by JJ Crawford. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on file 22CF126 and 1st status on 22CF24. Atty. goes over charges and penalties with the defendant and requests preliminary hearing. Atty. waives time limits. Matter set for preliminary hearing on 22CF126 with 22CF24 tracking to that date. Court in recess.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF212 & 22CF24
MUST COMPLY WITH PRE TRIAL SERVICES
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR ASHLEY HAFFERKAMP.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-956

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Luis O. Cruz appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Tony Kim appeared in court for Luis O. Cruz. Take off 3/2 hearing in front of Judge Koss. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

Defendant Luis O. Cruz in court with attorney Tony Kim.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant Quashed. Bond Reinstaed. BFH Canceled.  Reading of complaint waived.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Court finds defendant is freely, knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to prelim. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:50pm.  Attorney Tony Kim appeared.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant to issue.  Bond forfeited.  Unknown why defendant does not appear.  Minutes filed.
